args.natural_language_statement: Let n ≥ 6 and let N be a proper normal subgroup of A_n. For a fixed i ∈ {1,…,n}, let G_i = {σ ∈ A_n : σ(i) = i} be the subgroup of permutations that fix i. Show that N contains G_i.

retrieved_examples.nl: Let n >= 6 and N be a proper normal subgroup of A_n. For a fixed i in {1,...,n}, let G_i = {σ in A_n : σ(i)=i} be the subgroup of permutations that fix i. Show that N contains G_i.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

open Sym

variable (n : ℕ) (hn : 6 ≤ n)

-- A_n denotes the alternating group on n letters
lemma proper_normal_contains_stabilizer (N : Subgroup (AlternatingGroup (Fin n))) (hN : N ≠ ⊤) (hi : i : Fin n) :
  -- G_i := {σ ∈ A_n | σ i = i} is contained in N
  (Subgroup.map (fun σ => σ) (Subgroup.stabilizer i : Subgroup (AlternatingGroup (Fin n)))) ≤ N := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Equiv

/-- Let n ≥ 6 and let N be a proper normal subgroup of A_n. For a fixed i ∈ {1,…,n},
    let G_i = {σ ∈ A_n : σ(i) = i} be the subgroup of permutations that fix i.
    Show that N contains G_i. -/
theorem srdoty_alg_Sylow_771 (n : ℕ) (hn : 6 ≤ n) (i : Fin n)
  (N : Subgroup (AlternatingGroup (Fin n))) (hN : N ≠ ⊤) :
  { σ : AlternatingGroup (Fin n) | (σ : Perm (Fin n)) i = i } ⊆ (N : Set (AlternatingGroup (Fin n))) := by sorry
